FuncDef:
The dhcp through-nak command enables a device to transparently transmit NAK messages sent by the DHCP server in response to the Discover messages to DHCP clients in DHCP remote address pool scenarios.
The undo dhcp through-nak command disables the function.
By default, a device is disabled from transparently transmitting NAK messages sent by the DHCP server in response to the Discover messages to DHCP clients in DHCP remote address pool scenarios.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In scenarios where IP addresses are assigned from a DHCP remote address pool, if a DHCP client sends a Discover message to the DHCP server through a BRAS and the BRAS receives a NAK message from the DHCP server, the BRAS discards the NAK message by default. To prevent this problem, run the dhcp through-nak command to enable the BRAS to transparently transmit NAK messages to the clients.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
